turns.raw_header: You used the tag `!<q>` before your message. That isn’t a standard, widely documented command format, but I can still respond to the content that follows it.
turns.footer: I’m here and working—what would you like to test or try next?

parsed_footer.raw: I’m here and working—what would you like to test or try next?

turns.raw_header: You used `!<o>` this time—like `!<q>`, it’s not a standard command I recognize, but I’ll just treat the rest as your message:
turns.body:
> second test

I’m receiving your messages correctly.
turns.footer: Want to explain what `!<q>` / `!<o>` are meant to do, or should we just ignore them and continue normally?
